questions: What is the element used to create an HTML form for user input?
answer: <form>.

questions: What are input elements?
answer: An element that represents a typed data field.

questions: What is the <input> element used for?
answer: It is used to display an input fields that allow for content to be typed into the input box.

questions: What is the type attribute used for within the input field?
answer: It specifies the type of content that will be used within the input field.

questions: What is the type='text' attribute used for within the input field?
answer: Displays a single-line text input field.

questions: What is the type='radio' attribute used for within the input field?
answer: It displays a radio button which allows for multi-selection.

questions: What is the type='checkbox' attribute used for within the input field?
answer: It displays a checkbox button which allows for multi-selection.

questions: What is the type='submit' attribute used for within the input field?
answer: It displays submit button.

questions: What is the type='button' attribute used for within the input field?
answer: It displays a clickable button.

questions: What is the action='' attribute used for?
answer: It defines the action that is performed when the form is submitted to the server side.

questions: What is the target='_blank' attribute used for?
answer: It is used to open up a new tab when the element is clicked.

questions: What is the method='' attribute used for?
answer: It specifies the HTTP method to be used when submitting the form data.

questions: What is the main use of a <label> element?
answer: It is used to create a caption for a form control.

questions: What two elements are used to connect the label and input element together?
answer: The for attribute is used within label, and the id attribute is used within the input element.

questions: What is the main use of a <select> tag?
answer: It creates a drop down menu.

questions: True of False: is <option> or <options> the correct syntax for the drop down items within a select element?
answer: <option>.

questions: <What is the difference between <ul> and <ol> tags??
answer: <ul> is and unordered list i.e., dot jots. <ol> is an ordered list i.e., a numbered list.

questions: True or False: the <textarea> element defines a single input field?
answer: False. It defines a multi-line input field.

questions: True or False: elements contain attributes?
answer: True.

questions: What is the difference between the rows and cols attribute?
answer: The rows attribute specifies the visible number of lines in a text area, and the cols attribute specifies the visible width of a text area.
